intro: Cordia kabarensis, commonly known as the Kabare cordia, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, white to pink flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
